candidates.description:
move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.DrJavaPropertySetup
Rationale: The method deals with JVM arguments and settings, which are likely part of the configuration setup for the DrJava application. Moving it to DrJavaPropertySetup aligns it with the management of application properties.

move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.DrJavaPropertySetup
Rationale: The method sanitizeMasterJVMArgs deals with JVM arguments and settings, which aligns closely with the responsibilities of DrJavaPropertySetup, as it likely manages the configuration and setup of properties related to the DrJava application.

move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.DrJavaPropertySetup
Rationale: The method sanitizeSlaveJVMXMX deals with configuration settings related to the JVM heap size, which aligns with the responsibilities of DrJavaPropertySetup in managing and setting up properties for the DrJava application.

move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.DrJavaPropertySetup
Rationale: The method sanitizeMasterJVMXMX deals with configuration settings related to the JVM heap size, which aligns with the responsibilities of DrJavaPropertySetup in managing and setting up properties.

move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.DrJavaPropertySetup
Rationale: The method sanitizeJavadocCustomParams deals with Javadoc parameters and settings, which aligns closely with the responsibilities of DrJavaPropertySetup, as it likely manages various properties and configurations related to the DrJava environment.

move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.JavaSystemProperty
Rationale: The method checkHeapSize() deals with JVM settings and configurations, which aligns well with the responsibilities of the JavaSystemProperty class, as it likely handles system-level properties and configurations.

move method to edu.rice.cs.drjava.config.OptionConstants
Rationale: The method getNextBiggerHeapSize() directly interacts with OptionConstants.heapSizeChoices, making it logical to move this method to the OptionConstants class where heap size choices are defined.
